Job Description

Allstate is looking to hire Data Enigneers to join our Innovation team at our downtown Chicago and Menlo Park(SF Bay area) locations.

Our team works on a diverse set of data and systems including accident data, biometrics, location data, computer vision, mobility data, demographics, and deep learning tools to create Life solutions, safety solutions, and cutting-edge risk assessing platforms. This is a great opportunity to work with a talented team of some of the world's leading experts to build groundbreaking solutions.

The Senior Data Engineer will develop novel techniques for on-boarding and analyzing both structured and semi-structured data to create solution for advanced risk prediction, new products, and services development. He/she will also assist in efforts to evaluate, extract, scrub/prep, analyze and visualize a host of internal and external datasets using machine learning and statistical analysis and communicate to various stakeholders across and outside the company. The team is responsible for defining the strategy, building solutions, managing the product portfolio and building end user applications in new and emerging domains.

Job Description

In this role we are seeking for a Senior Data Engineer with data analytics background that can lead the creation of a complex data lake. The role will support the identification, selection and standardization of the data based products and services. Additional responsibilities include:
  • Become the internal data owner for this data-driven initiative, execute project aspects in partnership with internal and external constituencies.
  • Partner with internal teams to drive technical decisions using data, and support integration into Allstate systems.
  • Identification, evaluation, and prioritization of data sources. Provide feedback on data quality, integrity, and value for the project
  • Story ownership in an agile process. Deliver data ingestion, cleansing, normalization, provenance, and data processing results for analysis and product needs.
  • Execute the product vision, value proposition, and positioning for the data platforms
  • Process input from Customers and internal sources to provide clear product and project prioritization.
  • Develop and define data content for data products and services.
  • Work with Development, Operations, and Project Management to ensure development and delivery of products on time and manage expectations.
  • Exhibit strong sense of ownership and ability to work in global team environment.
  • Work closely with Allstate's Data and Analytics team to deliver data sets that meet project analytical needs.
  • Support ongoing relationships and strategic alignment with product stakeholders for key customer accounts.
Job Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree required, preferable in Computer Science/Business Information Systems/GIS/Data Science.
  • Advanced Analytic Data Sourcing and Content Management skills
  • Computer Proficiency in RDBMS, UNIX, Linux, Advanced SQL
  • Advanced skills in either Python, Scala, or Java is required
  • Experience with Hadoop technology stack including Spark, Hive, MapReduce, etc.
  • Experience with Dimensional Modeling, Tableau, Cloudera or other Hadoop distributions
  • 5 to 10 years of experience in highly data driven projects.
  • Strong technical skills or experience in a technically complex product development environment (e.g. database or software applications).
  • Background in information systems, big data and analytics experience a must with close familiarity with contemporary tools and agile methodologies
  • Experience driving business decisions - as key technical lead gathering and managing business requirements
  • Ability to execute in a cross-functional team environment spread across many departments, while driving for desired outcomes.
  • Ability to operate in a dynamic, fast moving environment, and communicate complex ideas in a clear, concise manner both verbally and in writing.
  • Results oriented as demonstrated by proven ability to meet short deadlines and execute against multiple competing priorities with little direct supervision.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.
